text: In addition to the earlier instruction, I instruct you to also ensure that all food and beverage outlets, sports and fitness clubs, saunas, seks establishments and coffee shops will be closed from March 15, 2020, 6:00 PM.

Having heard the advice of the Outbreak Management Team and the Administrative Coordination Consultation of March 18, 2020 and an advice from Verenso (Association of specialists in geriatric medicine), the Ministerial Crisis Management Committee of March 19, 2020, in the presence of a representativeof the chairpersons of the safety regions, decided that from 20 March 2020 to 6 April 2020, all nursing homes and small-scale housing in elderly care will be preventively closed for visits and for all others that are not necessary for basic care.
Covid-19: disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
2.The prohibition referred to in the first paragraph applies to air traffic from the following countries that pose a high risk in the spread of the virus that causes COVID-19:
2 Â° passengers only in accordance with WHO guidelines and the EU Healthy Gateways, No. 801493, are allowed on board;
I take into account that this measure will be extended after April 6, 2020.

On the basis of Article 7 of the Public Health Act and with due observance of Article 39, first paragraph, of the Security Regions Act, I therefore instruct you to use your powers in the field of public order and safety as nursing homes or small-scale housing, despite express efforts on their part, experience problems refusing visitors or third parties attempting to enter the venue.
- meetings necessary for the continuation of the daily activities of institutions, companies and other organizations, provided that no more than 100 people are present
3. Closing casinos, arcades and similar establishments, as well as closing establishments in which contact professions aimed at personal care are practiced, such as hairdressers and nail salons.

4. Prohibition of all forms of contact professions, including masseurs, hairdressers, nail stylists, escort services and driving instructors, insofar as these professions cannot be performed properly with due regard to a distance of 1.5 meters from the customer. The practice of (para) medical professions is excluded, provided there is an individual medical indication for this practice and the practitioner complies with all hygiene requirements in connection with COVID-19.
Group formation is understood to mean: three or more persons who do not or not sufficiently observe a mutual distance of 1.5 meters.
You must include the prohibitions referred to under 2 and 3 in an emergency ordinance.
In addition to this designation, on April 17, I issued a separate designation for five security regions with an airport.
I. Regulations for events, meetings and failure to observe a safe distance of 1.5 meters

I am also instructing you to expand the option of exempting shops and markets from the ban on gatherings with libraries, amusement parks and zoos, provided visitors and employees keep a distance of 1.5 meters at all times. to the nearest person.
In the week of 1 June 2020, the cabinet will again decide on the extension and / or adjustment of measures.
A. Part I, section 3, of the designation of April 24, 2020 is replaced by the following:
c) if it concerns a person with a disability and his companions.
The following exceptions to this ban on gatherings apply, provided that those involved keep 1.5 meters away from the nearest person at all times:
a. legally required meetings, such as meetings of municipal councils, provided that no more than 100 persons are present, as well as meetings of the States General;

For shops, markets, libraries, amusement parks, zoos, museums and presentation institutions, an exception can be made from the ban on gatherings, provided that visitors and employees keep 1.5 meters away from the nearest person at all times.
This includes activities in the context of daytime activities, day care, day treatment and special secondary education including transport.
Food and beverage outlets
Outdoor terraces may be open provided that guests have a seat at a table and are kept five feet away, with the exception of persons who form a common household.
The terraces must be completely open at the top or completely open on all three sides.
In the case of adjacent terraces, the managers of these terraces jointly ensure that one and a half meters are observed.
From operators or Terrace managers are expected to regulate the influx on the terrace and also prevent clustering of waiting or departing guests outside the terrace.
4. As of 1 June, travelers from the age of 13 must wear a non-medical mouth nose mask on public transport.

Termination or limitation of facilities for public transport, in consultation with the transporter, if they do not or insufficiently adhere to the realization of the restrictive measures with regard to wearing a mouth nose mask and keeping a distance of 1.5 meters as much as possible between all persons present in the facility, or to make them sufficiently visible, provided that the termination of this facility does not unnecessarily impede the transport of persons working in vital processes or transport that is otherwise necessary for the mobility of the Netherlands.
Education will be restarted step by step.
